intro: Blepharis cuanzensis, commonly known as the Cuanza grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale blue or violet, and it produces small, three-angled fruits. Blepharis cuanzensis is often found in open grasslands and is a component of the local flora in its native range.
